metadata.title: CVE-2021-40633 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak (out-of-memory) in gif2rgb in util/gif2rgb.c in giflib 5.1.4allows remote attackers trigger an out of memory exception or denial ofservice via a gif format file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

giflib-tools - 5.1.4-0.3~16.04.1+esm1
libgif4 - 5.1.4-0.3~16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: giflib package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.4-0.3~16.04.1+esm1').
